messageBody:
Hi guys.
I was wondering if anyone has ever investigated the possibility of using a
custom classloader to transparantly (to the tested code) provide non standard
implementations of collaberating classes without having to provide
constructors or setters to specify an implementation of every type used in a
class.

A simple example of this would be to test a class which uses the a Date or
Calander class to get the current time, for testing purposes it would be nice
to be able to mock up a class that returned a constant time. This could be
done by passing in an instance of the date class in the constructor, or by
using setters, but may be neater (especially if you don't have the luxury of
doing TDD) to be able to this external to the tested code.

I've not investigated or experimented with the plausibility of this yet, just
wondering if anybody else has already tried and discounted the idea :-)

Cheers
Shez
